text: Is there any way to include help text with a HubL tag when using `export_to_template_context`? i.e. I’m using a `{% choice %}` tag to allow switching a template-level choice, and want to provide some help text info.
Instead of using a choice field you should make a custom module with a choice field and add an help text to that field and export that module as template context
Yeah, don’t really want to have an extra module file for something so basic just to add a quick line of help text though, but I guess that’s probably the only way. I think I’ll just forgo it. Thanks.

Hello,
How can I store the value of an HTML form element stored in Hubl variable.
Hey Tom, do you know how to make the filters on these be jquery so that you dont have to load a new page?

When using HubSpot forms, if you’re storing the value as a contact property it will be in the contacts record, you can use HubL to render the contacts data.

If you’re trying to use it for a thank you page - do know that the redirect is often faster than the database storing the data. This means if you use HubL to display immediately on that page something the user just submitted the value may not be ready for the page to display just yet.

You can adjust for this by using JavaScript to either set a cookie with that value, or change the redirect to include the value as a query parameter. That way you can access it with HubL on the subsequent page.
